description: Former Australian captain Steve Waugh has hailed Virat Kohli as the "greatest one-day player of all time" and a "once-in-a-generation" talent. Waugh praised Kohli's batting prowess and consistency in limited-overs cricket, noting his record 51 ODI centuries. He also commented on India's evolving T20 setup post-Kohli and Rohit's retirements from the format.

Mumbai: Two dead, three injured in local train accident amid strike
description: Two people died and three were injured when a suburban train struck them near Sandhurst Road railway station in Mumbai. The incident followed a protest by railway unions that disrupted services. This disruption caused overcrowding and stranded passengers. The protest was against an FIR filed in connection with a previous train accident.

description: Veteran Democrat Nancy Pelosi, 85, announced she will not seek re-election to Congress after four decades, concluding her term as the first female Speaker of the House. Her departure follows a significant political victory with California's congressional map reshaping. Pelosi's influential career included steering major legislation and leading impeachments of Donald Trump.

description: Godman Asaram has been granted six months' bail by the Gujarat high court for medical treatment, mirroring a similar bail granted by the Rajasthan high court. He is serving a life sentence in the Gujarat case for raping a disciple between 2001 and 2006. Asaram also faces a life sentence in a separate rape case in Rajasthan.

title: Rape accused tutor who jumped bail 24 years ago in Kerala tracked down to Chennai, arrested
WPL Retentions: Harman, Smriti, Shafali kept; Lanning, Deepti released ahead of auction
description: WPL franchises unveiled their retained players, with Indian stars Harmanpreet Kaur, Smriti Mandhana, Jemimah Rodrigues, and Shafali Verma headlining the list. Mumbai Indians and Delhi Capitals kept five players each, while UP Warriorz released several marquee names, including Deepti Sharma. A high-stakes mega auction is set for November 27.

Pak breaks truce again: Civilian areas shelled, says Kabul; peace talks on
description: Pakistan has reportedly violated the ceasefire by firing into Afghanistan, even as officials meet in Istanbul for renewed talks with Taliban representatives. This comes after a previous agreement for a ceasefire and a monitoring mechanism, following deadly border clashes. The ongoing discussions aim to de-escalate tensions between the neighbours.

description: In a historic first, India's armless para-archer Sheetal Devi has been selected for the Indian able-bodied junior team for the Asia Cup Stage 3. The 18-year-old world champion secured third place in national trials, competing alongside over 60 able-bodied archers. This achievement marks a significant step towards her dream of competing with able-bodied athletes.

India yet to lose T20I series under coach Gambhir: A look at his streak
description: India secured a commanding 48-run victory against Australia in the fourth T20I. This win gives India a 2-1 series lead. Under coach Gautam Gambhir, the team remains unbeaten in the T20 series. India posted 167/8, with Shubman Gill scoring 46. Washington Sundar took three wickets. Australia was bowled out for 119. India's T20 unit appears strong.

description: India secured an unassailable 2-1 series lead against Australia with a commanding 48-run victory in the fourth T20I. This win highlights India's composure and adaptability under captain Suryakumar Yadav.

ED attaches Raina, Dhawan's Rs 11.14cr assets - what we know so far
description: The Enforcement Directorate has provisionally attached assets worth Rs 11.14 crore belonging to former cricketers Suresh Raina and Shikhar Dhawan. The action stems from an investigation into the illegal offshore betting platform 1xBet, which promoted betting through surrogate brands. Both cricketers allegedly entered endorsement agreements with foreign entities to promote 1xBet, with payments channelled through foreign entities to conceal illicit origins.

Both leaders traded insults, with Sinha blaming Kumar's men for stopping their vehicle and engaging in hooliganism.

Rashmika and Vijay’s wedding date revealed; destination wedding in Udaipur - Report
description: Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda are reportedly planning a grand wedding. Following a private engagement last October, the couple is rumored to be tying the knot on February 26, 2026. Reports suggest a royal destination wedding in Udaipur. Fans eagerly await confirmation from the popular actors. Both stars have upcoming film projects.

title: 'I would have dropped out of college if...': Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang to Mark Zuckerberg
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang and Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg shared insights on generative AI and their entrepreneurial journeys. Huang humorously wished he'd dropped out of college like Zuckerberg, given Nvidia's long path to becoming a $5 trillion company.

title: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife MacKenzie Scott makes large donation; focus on education
description: MacKenzie Scott has gifted Howard University $80 million, one of the largest single donations in its history, to support general operations and its College of Medicine. This significant contribution arrives as the university faces delays in federal funding due to a government shutdown. The donation continues Scott's recent pattern of substantial gifts to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives.

title: Gisele Bündchen Says Prioritizing Tom Brady Took a Personal Toll
description: Supermodel Gisele Bündchen, in a candid interview, shared insights into her marriage with Tom Brady, describing their split as a 'death and rebirth.' She detailed her journey of shifting from supporting her partner's career to rediscovering her own dreams and defining personal success. Bündchen emphasizes her graciousness towards Brady, highlighting her focus on authenticity and fulfillment in her new chapter.
